Three baskets or Treasuries, a name of the Buddhist scriptures. The Buddhist scriptures consist of three great divisions, each of which is called piṭakaṃ, "a basket". They are vinayapiṭakaṃ, suttapiṭakaṃ, abhidhammapiṭakaṃ, or the basket of Discipline, the basket of Discourses, and the basket of Metaphysics. The whole canon is called tīṇi piṭakāni or tipiṭakaṃ, or piṭakattayaṃ, "the three baskets."
